attributes.action: Haggerston Park Gate entrance on Whiston Road
attributes.additional_details:
MAKE THE GATE SAFE!

On September 1 six-year-old Lulu died after running out of an open gate in Haggerston Park and onto busy Whiston Road. She suffered fatal injuries after being hit by a car. Her death came after park users repeated asked the authorities to make the entrance on Whiston Road safe with a simple swing-hinge.

They said not adding it was not their responsibility. Council chiefs have steadfastly refused to do anything despite her death and a series of near misses involving toddlers.

We fear the authorities will only listen when a child has died.

Don’t let that happen. Sign this petition and save a life. A simple swing mechanism will make the gate safe.

We the undersigned petition Hackney Council to put a simple swing-hinge on the entrance to Haggerston Park. This will guard against small children and dogs running out onto the road while keeping the access point.

rejection.details: I'm afraid this isn't one for the Government - it can't intervene - but for the council.  Possibly involve your local MP?
